original_solution_mapping.L3: So the total number of red stripes is 6+1=<<6+1=7>>7 red stripes
original_solution_mapping.L4: So he has a total of 7*10=<<7*10=70>>70 red stripes

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3399.
    Returns: the total number of red stripes on all flags.
    """
    # L1
    total_stripes_per_flag = 13 # Each flag has 13 stripes
    first_red_stripe = 1 # the first stripe is red
    remaining_stripes = total_stripes_per_flag - first_red_stripe

    # L2
    half_divisor = 2 # half of the remaining stripes are also red
    red_stripes_from_remaining = remaining_stripes / half_divisor

    # L3
    total_red_stripes_per_flag = red_stripes_from_remaining + first_red_stripe

    # L4
    number_of_flags = 10 # John buys 10 flags
    total_red_stripes_all_flags = total_red_stripes_per_flag * number_of_flags

    # FA
    answer = total_red_stripes_all_flags
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: So the total number of red stripes is {red_stripes_from_remaining}+{first_red_stripe}=<<{red_stripes_from_remaining}+{first_red_stripe}={total_red_stripes_per_flag}>>{total_red_stripes_per_flag} red stripes
So he has a total of {total_red_stripes_per_flag}*{number_of_flags}=<<{total_red_stripes_per_flag}*{number_of_flags}={total_red_stripes_all_flags}>>{total_red_stripes_all_flags} red stripes
